summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019. The report describes the incident, Epstein's behavior, and conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate regarding what occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who allegedly attempted suicide; observed lying on his cell floor with a red neck, breathing heavily and snoring, and later exhibited unpredictable behavior.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported the incident, stating he found Epstein with a string around his neck and called the guards.

connections.description: Shared a prison cell; Epstein accused Nick of attempting to kill him, while Nick reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., a call for assistance was announced for the Special Housing Unit. Jeffrey Epstein was found lying on his cell floor, breathing heavily with a red neck. He was placed on suicide watch after exhibiting concerning behavior.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit
events.description: Epstein returned from a legal visit at approximately 8:00 PM, after which staff handed him a copy of the Daily News.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell in a fetal position with a red neck, breathing heavily and snoring, after a reported suicide attempt.
Epstein accused his cellmate, Nick, of attempting to kill him and harassing him, while Nick claimed he found Epstein with a string around his neck.
Epstein exhibited unpredictable behavior, including pretending to be unconscious and attempting to fall head-first off his bed while on suicide watch.
Medical assessment was delayed as no medical staff was available after 10:00 PM; Epstein was later treated for a circular line of erythema at the base of his neck.
Epstein mentioned that his picture was in the Daily News and that he was reported to be worth seventy-seven million dollars.
